Meta.ShortDescription: he softening of the bones caused by impaired bone metabolism primarily due to inadequate levels of available phosphate, calcium, and vitamin D, or because of resorption of calcium.

Diagnostics.Diagnostic: Low systemic levels of circulating mineral ions necessary for bone and tooth mineralization
Accumulation of mineralization-inhibiting proteins and peptides (such as osteopontin annd ASARM peptides) in the extracellular matrix of bones and teeth.
Low serum phospate (except in cases of renal osteodystrophy)
Elevated serum alkaline phosphatase (due to increased osteoblast activity)
Elevated parathyroid hormone (due to low calcium)
A technetium bone scan will show increased activity (due to osteoblasts)

Treatments.Treatment: 4-6 weeks of Vitamin D (10,000 IU weekly) and Calcium supplements are synergistic
